ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The characterized_definition type allows for the designation of a , a
or a
to which properties may be assigned.

The characterized_product_definition type allows for the designation of a
or a
to which properties may be assigned.
Selection of a
means that the property is applied to the
attribute in the context of its
attribute.
This enables properties of a given product that depend on the usages of this product to be described.
The shape of a gasket depends upon whether or not it is an element of an assembly and, if it is an element of an assembly, the shape depends upon the assembly in which it participates.
The derived_property_select type allows for the selection of a , an , or a .

The shape_definition type allows for the designation of a , a , or a .
References to a
are references to the relationship itself and not to one of the associated .

A characterized_object is the identification of an item that has associated property information.
A characterized_object is characterized by the properties which refer to it.
The properties of a characterized_object may be used as an environmental condition under which the properties of a product are measured.
If a product has a set of properties that are measured within a room or an atmosphere, the room or atmosphere may be described with instances of the entity data type characterized_object.

the
by which the characterized_object is known.

the
that characterizes the characterized_object. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

A characterized_object_relationship is a relationship between two instances of the entity data type
and provides an identification and description of this relationship.
The role of characterized_object_relationship can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
Relationships represented using this entity may be parent child relationship. Annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity specify whether or not the relationship is directed.
This entity, together with the
entity, is based on the relationship template that is described in annex E.3.

A component_path_shape_aspect is a type of
that identifies a portion of a shape of an assembly by referencing a
that represents a portion of the shape of an occurrence of a part within this assembly. The referenced part and its
might be defined locally or externally.

the occurrence of a part by its
or .

the locally or externally defined . In the case that it is externally defined, only the
of the externally defined
is provided.

the combination of
and
shall be unique.

the
by which the characterized_object_relationship is known.

the
that characterizes the characterized_object_relationship. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
one of the instances of
that is a part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
the other instance of
that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A general_property is an identification of a type of property.
An annotated Express schema can use this entity to identify a property selected in a library of properties.
If needed, a general_property may be a member of a group.
"Kinematic viscosity", defined in ISO 31, is an example of a general_property.

ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

The context in which id is used as a discriminating characteristic can be identified in an annotated Express schema that uses or specializes this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
the
by which the general_property is known.
ext_description.example: 'Kinematic viscosity' is an example of name.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the
that characterizes the general_property. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

A general_property_association is an association of an instance of one of the types listed in
with a . The
serves as the reference definition for the considered property.
In order to characterize the kinematic viscosity of a fluid, an instance of general_property_association would relate an instance of
that defines the concept of kinematic viscosity and an instance of
that defines the kinematic characteristics of an instance of
defining the fluid.

the
by which the general_property_association is known.

the
that characterizes the general_property_association. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

the
that provides the definition of the considered characteristic.
the , for which the identification of the considered characteristic is provided by a .

In the case that the derived_definition is of type , or
it shall be referred to by at most one general_property_association.

In the case that the derived_definition is of type , or
the attribute name of the derived_definition shall be the same as the attribute name of the base_definition.

A general_property_relationship is a relationship between two instances of the entity data type
and provides an identification and description of this relationship.
This entity, together with the
entity, is based on the relationship template that is described in annex E.3

ext_description.p:
the
by which the general_property_relationship is known.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the
that characterizes the general_property_relationship. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
one of the instance of
that is a part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
the other instance of
that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other this attribute shall be the dependent one.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A product_definition_shape is a type of . It identifies the shape of an object. A product_definition_shape identifies the shape of a
or of one of the types reachable as .
A product_definition_shape need not be associated with any geometric representation.
Early in the design of a product there may not be a specific idea about the shape of the product but there may be certain characteristics of the shape that are to be represented. Those product shape characteristics can be attached to the product shape using this entity.
A geometric representation of shape is not needed to assert facts such as, "a shape must fit within a 5 centimetre cube".
There shall not be two instances of product_definition_shape referring to the same item.
The definition attribute shall not refer to a .

A property_definition is a property that characterizes a single object.
The type of the characterized item is one of the entity types that may be selected directly or indirectly with .
The role of property_definition can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

the
by which the property_definition is known.

the
that characterizes the property_definition. The value of the attribute need not be specified.
the item whose property is identified.

ext_description.note: This attribute is an upwardly compatible addition to property_definition as specified in ISO 10303-41:1994.

The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

The context in which id is used as a discriminating characteristic can be identified in an annotated Express schema that uses or specializes this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
Each property_definition shall be the
in at most one .
ext_description.note:
The
data type is defined in basic_attribute_schema of this part of ISO 10303.
A template for constraining the population of the entity data types defined in the basic_attribute_schema is described in annex E.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A shape_aspect is an identified element of the shape of an object or is part of another shape_aspect. A shape_aspect that is part of another shape_aspect allows decomposition of a shape_aspect.
Consider the
of a bolt. One might distinguish, as an element of this shape, the concept of the threaded portion of its shank. This portion of the shape could be specified using a shape_aspect entity so that other properties, such as surface finish, may be associated with it.

the
by which the shape_aspect is known.

the
that characterizes the shape_aspect. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
the
of which this entity is an aspect.
ext_description.example:
If the identified aspect is the threaded portion of a bolt's shank, this attribute would be the
of the bolt.

ext_description.p: an indication that the shape_aspect is on the physical boundary of the . If the value of this attribute is TRUE, the shape_aspect being identified is on such a boundary. If the value is FALSE, the shape_aspect being identified is not on such a boundary. If the value is UNKNOWN, it is not known whether or not the shape_aspect being identified is on such a boundary.
ext_description.example: If the identified shape_aspect is the threaded portion of a bolt's shank, the value of this attribute would be TRUE. If it is the centre-line, the value would be FALSE.

ext_description.note: This attribute is an upwardly compatible addition to shape_aspect as specified in ISO 10303-41:1994.

The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

The context in which id is used as a discriminating characteristic can be identified in an annotated Express schema that uses or specializes this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: In the case that an id is provided, it shall be unique within the referenced .

ext_description.p:
Each shape_aspect shall be the
in at most one .
ext_description.note:
The
data type is defined in basic_attribute_schema of this part of ISO 10303.
A template for constraining the population of the entity data types defined in the basic_attribute_schema is described in annex E.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
In the case that a shape_aspect is part of another shape_aspect the graph established by the attribute
shall not be cyclic.

A shape_aspect_occurrence is a type of
that is defined by another
or a .

the
or
that is defining this shape_aspect.

In the case that a shape_aspect_occurrence is defined by another shape_aspect_occurrence the graph established by the attribute
shall not be cyclic.

A shape_aspect_relationship is a relationship between two instances of the entity data type
and provides an identification and description of their relationship.
The role of shape_aspect_relationship can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
If one
is part of another, this entity could be used to associate the two s.
Each
entity may have different properties.
No actual physical relationship is established between related instances of the entity data type .
A shape_aspect_relationship might relate two instances of the entity data type
whose representations are the equivalent surfaces of a mould and a moulded product. The shape of the mould is not spatially related to the moulded product.
Relationships represented using this entity may be parent child relationship. Annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity specify whether or not the relationship is directed.
This entity, together with the
entity, is based on the relationship template that is described in annex E.3.

the
by which the shape_aspect_relationship is known.

the
that characterizes the shape_aspect_relationship. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
one of the instances of
that is a part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
ext_description.example:
A
with five faces would play the role of relating_shape_aspect in five instances of the entity data type shape_aspect_relationship: one per face.

ext_description.p:
the other instance of
that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
This attribute is an upwardly compatible addition to shape_aspect_relationship as specified in ISO 10303-41:1994.

The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

The context in which id is used as a discriminating characteristic can be identified in an annotated Express schema that uses or specializes this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
Each shape_aspect_relationship shall be the
in at most one .
ext_description.note:
The
data type is defined in basic_attribute_schema of this part of ISO 10303.
A template for constraining the population of the entity data types defined in the basic_attribute_schema is described in annex E.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The acyclic_characterized_object_relationship function determines whether the graph of instances of the entity data type
that contains relation as one of its links contains a cycle. This function may be used to evaluate either a
or any of its subtypes.
The function returns TRUE if no cycle has been detected. Otherwise it returns FALSE.
The algorithm of the function is explained in annex E.2.
This function is not used in this schema. It is defined here because other ISO 10303 integrated resources and application protocols that use the
entity include rules that use this function.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

(input) the set of instances of the entity data type
that the function is searching for in the
parameter of the relation argument.

(input) the fully qualified entity name of a type of
entity.

The acyclic_general_property_relationship function determines whether the graph of instances of the entity data type
that contains relation as one of its links contains a cycle. This function may be used to evaluate either a
or any of its subtypes.
The function returns TRUE if no cycle has been detected. Otherwise it returns FALSE.
The algorithm of the function is explained in annex E.2.
This function is not used in this schema. It is defined here because other ISO 10303 integrated resources and application protocols that use the
entity include rules that use this function.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

(input) the set of instances of the entity data type
that the function is searching for in the
parameter of the relation argument.

(input) the fully qualified entity name of a type of
entity.

The acyclic_shape_aspect function determines whether the graph of instances of the entity data type
that are linked by the attribute
contains a cycle.
The function returns TRUE if no cycle has been detected. Otherwise it returns FALSE.
The algorithm of the function is explained in annex E.2.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

The acyclic_shape_aspect_occurrence function determines whether the graph of instances of the entity data type
that are linked by the attribute
contains a cycle.
The function returns TRUE if no cycle has been detected. Otherwise it returns FALSE.
The algorithm of the function is explained in annex E.2.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

The acyclic_shape_aspect_relationship function determines whether the graph of instances of the entity data type
that contains relation as one of its links contains a cycle. This function may be used to evaluate either a
or any of its subtypes.
The function returns TRUE if no cycle has been detected. Otherwise it returns FALSE.
The algorithm of the function is explained in annex E.2.
This function is not used in this schema. It is defined here because other ISO 10303 integrated resources and application protocols that use the
entity include rules that use this function.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

(input) the set of instances of the entity data type
that the function is searching for in the
parameter of the relation argument.

entity.

the set of instances of
that refer to the instance of
through an instance of .
This function is not used in this schema.
